intro: Cucullaria racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cucullaria racemosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
